description: Comprehensive MusicBrainz relationship schema with all entity types, relationships, and attributes

attribute_definitions.name: start_date
attribute_definitions.description: The date when the relationship began

attribute_definitions.name: end_date
attribute_definitions.description: The date when the relationship ended

attribute_definitions.name: additional
attribute_definitions.description: Indicates a minor or less prominent role

attribute_definitions.name: guest
attribute_definitions.description: Indicates the artist was a guest performer

attribute_definitions.name: original
attribute_definitions.description: Indicates an original member of a group

attribute_definitions.name: eponymous
attribute_definitions.description: Indicates a member the band is named after

attribute_definitions.name: cover
attribute_definitions.description: Indicates the recording is a cover version

attribute_definitions.name: partial
attribute_definitions.description: Recording contains only part of the work

attribute_definitions.name: number
attribute_definitions.description: Number in a series or movement

relations.description: Indicates that an artist is a member of a band
Links a stage name or alias to a person's legal name
Links artists who have collaborated, but not as a formal group
Links a tribute artist or group to the artist they are paying tribute to
Links a conductor to the group they conduct
Abstract parent type for performance credits
Standard way to credit an instrumentalist
Links a producer to a recording
Links an engineer to a recording
Links a mixer to a recording
Links a remixer to a recording
Links an editor to a recording
Links a composer to a musical work
Links a lyricist to a work
Links a librettist to an opera or musical work
Links an artist who created an arrangement
Links an orchestrator to a work
Links an artist who compiled a release
Links a DJ to their mix release
Links an artist to a label they founded
Indicates an artist was signed to a label
Links an artist to their area of origin
Links a group to where it was formed
Links artist to instrument they play
The official homepage for an artist
A link to a social media profile
Link to the artist's page on Discogs
This relationship indicates that a recording is a performance of a work
Used for movements of classical works or parts of a suite
Indicates that a work is an arrangement of another work
Indicates that a work is a medley containing other works
Links a work to another work from which it derives
Links a work containing translated lyrics to the original work
Links different versions of the same work
Links a work to its publisher
Places a recording on a release, forming a tracklist
Links a remix to the original recording
Links a recording that samples another recording
Links a cover recording to the original
Links a mashup to recordings it combines
Links an edited version to the original
Links recording to the place where it was made
Links a live recording to the event where it was captured

relations.long_link_phrase: can be purchased for download at {entity1}
{entity0} is part of the release group {entity1}
relations.description: Links a release to a release group
Links a release to the label(s) that published it
Indicates where a release was released

relations.long_link_phrase: can be purchased for download at {entity1}

relations.description: Links release group to a series
Official website specifically for the release group
Links a parent label to its sub-label/imprint
Links a place to the area containing it
Links venue complex to individual venues
Links event to event series (tour, festival)
Links instrument family to specific instruments

relationship_hierarchies.name: performer
relationship_hierarchies.description: Groups all types of performance credits

relationship_hierarchies.name: production
relationship_hierarchies.description: Groups all technical and production roles
